intro: Cynanchum brachystephanum, commonly known as the short-stephanum milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
